solution_line_template: When Carla was waiting on Monday she counted {ceiling_tiles_monday} ceiling tiles and on Tuesday she counted them twice, {ceiling_tiles_monday} ceiling tiles x {times_counted_tiles_tuesday} = <<{ceiling_tiles_monday}*{times_counted_tiles_tuesday}={tiles_counted_tuesday}>>{tiles_counted_tuesday} times she counted a ceiling tile.

She also counted {books_monday} books in the room on Monday and counted them three times in a row on Tuesday, {books_monday} books x {times_counted_books_tuesday} = <<{books_monday}*{times_counted_books_tuesday}={books_counted_tuesday}>>{books_counted_tuesday} times she counted a book.

On Tuesday Carla counted the ceiling tiles {tiles_counted_tuesday} times + counted books {books_counted_tuesday} times = <<{tiles_counted_tuesday}+{books_counted_tuesday}={total_counts_tuesday}>>{total_counts_tuesday} times Carla counted something on Tuesday.
